page.title: 08EASTER CUSTOMS IN LONGTON
page.content: Every year on {Good Friday }a Pram Race is run along Liverpool Road from The Walmer Bridge Inn to The Mansion House and back to Walmer Bridge. Entrants, who must be over 18 years old, dress as mother and baby, and must drink a pint of beer from each of four pubs along the route. There is usually an Easter Bonnet contest and roundabouts and brass bands from Hesketh Bank, Lostock Hall and Eccleston,to entertain the crowds many of whom are lining the route of the race.The money raised from the street collection is given to local charities and can amount to hundreds of pounds on a good sunny day. Recently some of the 'babies' have to ride in supermarket trolleys because there is a shortage of strong prams now that Mothers with cars only use baby buggies.
